title: Agricultural technology and migration of Bantu

content.question: By 1200 C.E. Improved agricultural technology had spread throughout much of sub-Saharan Africa primarily through the

choices.label: development of oxen immune to diseases carried by the tsetse fly
discovery of gold that provided a means of exchange among groups
expansion of the Sahara Desert, which forced Berber peoples to move south
migration of Bantu-speaking peoples with their knowledge of ironworking

content.answer: migration of Bantu-speaking peoples with their knowledge of ironworking

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
